desc: TP53BP1, a DNA repair protein, is mutated in a subset of skin cancers.

The TP53BP1 gene encodes a protein originally identified as a partner of tumor suppressor gene TP53. TP53BP1 plays a role in DNA damage recognition and DNA repair (PMID: 12364621, 21144835, 17190600, 18804090). Tumor suppressor roles for TP53BP1 have been described in several cancers, mostly related to functions of TP53, BRCA1 and ATM, although some contradictory results exist (PMID: 15970701, 17546051, 15279780, 12447382, 22266878, 20453858, 24681733). TP53BP1 is predominantly mutated in skin cancers such as cutaneous squamous cell carcinomas and melanomas (cBioPortal, MSKCC, Dec. 2016).
